attributes.action: Remove the newly implemented 20mph speed limit in Buckley, Flintshire.
attributes.additional_details:
It is causing frustrated drivers, leading to increased road rage and a higher chance of collision. 20mpg is also too slow to overtake a cyclist or slow moving vehicle such as a tractor with out breaking the speed limit. 

There has already been a collision on the day that the new speed limit was introduced. There is also not enough signs to effevtively inform drivers of the new speed limit
attributes.background: The newly implemented 20mph speed limit should only be in housing estates and around schools during school start/end time.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local speed limits are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
